 Obsolete - releasing is done automatically in the destructor.
 WindowHierarchyIterator (const Window *win=0)
 ~WindowHierarchyIterator ()

Detailed Description

Allows to iterate over all opened windows in the order of the window stack. Sample code: 
{
  const Application* active_app = System::GetActiveApplication();
  for (WindowHierarchyIterator it; it.Get() != 0; ++it) {
      Application* app = 0;
      Window* win = it.Get(&app);
      if (app == active_app) {
        // do something with the window...
      }
    }
  }
} // assure that the destructor of win_it is invoked as early as possible

Note that the window-stack will be locked until the destructor of the WindowHierarchyIterator will be invoked. To assure that the destructor is invoked as early as possible, it is recommended to put an additional scope around the code like shown in the example. It is not allowed to invoke window methods from a different application context than the window belongs to.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WindowHierarchyIterator::WindowHierarchyIterator (  const Window *  win = 0  ) 
 

Parameters:
win Optional input parameter, which defines the starting window. If 0 is used, the window which is on top is used.

WindowHierarchyIterator::~WindowHierarchyIterator (   ) 
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN WindowHierarchyIterator::Begin (  const Window *  win = 0  ) 
 

Resets the iterator to the begin. Returns TRUE if the window-stack contains at least one window. WindowHierarchyIterator::Get returns this window.

Parameters:
win Optional input parameter, which defines the starting window. If 0 is used, the window which is on top is used.

Window * WindowHierarchyIterator::Get (  Application **  app = 0  )  const
 

Returns the current window of the iterator.

Parameters:
app Optional output-parameter which contains the application the window belongs too.

BOOLEAN WindowHierarchyIterator::Next (   ) 
 

Returns TRUE if the window-stack has a next window. WindowHierarchyIterator::Get returns this window.

WindowHierarchyIterator WindowHierarchyIterator::operator++ (  INT   ) 
 

Moves the iterator to the next window.

Moves the iterator to the next window.

Moves the iterator to the previous window.

WindowHierarchyIterator & WindowHierarchyIterator::operator-- (   ) 
 

Moves the iterator to the previous window.

BOOLEAN WindowHierarchyIterator::Previous (   ) 
 

Returns TRUE if the window-stack has a previous window. WindowHierarchyIterator::Get returns this window.

void WindowHierarchyIterator::Release (   )  [inline]
 

Obsolete - releasing is done automatically in the destructor.
